item.title: How to install 32-bit BOINC on my 64-bit Raspberry Pi?
item.description: Why would you do this? Projects like UNIVERSE@HOME have no aarch64 Tasks. A Raspberry Pi 3b canÂ´t run ROSETTA@HOME because it doesn’t have enough ram. DietPi, a popular OS for the raspberry pi, uses 64Bit. Requirements 64-bit raspberry pi e.g. DietPi Type uname -a the output should contain the following: aarch64 if there is armhf in the output then you can skip to the [Install](#Install 32-bit Boinc) section. Example output: Linux raspberrypi-1 5.
